tweets.text: In #Hampshire & #IOW we are investigating the Cat Converter trade as part of #MetalTheft Week. Cat Cons are targeted for high value palladium, rhodium & aluminium.  Spotted suspicious behaviour? Call Crimestoppers 0800 555 111 @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/CsBBBQUIvt

No. 8 of 10 spoil heaps we're tackling this year. Toxic chemicals from this mound wash into the river nr #Nenthead and are carried all the way downstream and out to sea at #Tynemouth. We're using natural materials to stabilise it #reducingpollution @EnvAgencyYNE @CoalAuthority https://t.co/yGW6IbjV5X

Our Fisheries Enforcement Officers have been out patrolling the River Eden and checking anglers for rod licence compliance.

Today is the last day of the salmon season until the 15th January when it reopens.

#Eden #Cumbria #rod #licence #fishing https://t.co/eCsKpxWhZH

tweets.text: The #floodbank improvement work at #Sawley #Derbyshire is progressing well. The @EnvAgencyMids #TeamEA are working to improve a section of the #flood defences alongside the #RiverTrent and restore the @Derbyshirecc footpath 15 which runs on top of the bank. https://t.co/wrLjVA0S8h
@DouglasPilot @CroxtethHall @EnvAgencyNW @ccnw1 @cpvolgroup I'll be there on Friday at about 10:15 with @SimonBennettEA and possibly Paul. Maybe see you then? - Rebecca

Great to see @Dunne4Ludlow's Sewage (Inland Waters) bill published today. 

The volume of unmonitored, untreated sewage still flowing into rivers is shocking. Hope Government will support the bill, backed up with capital investment and @EnvAgency funding in the #SpendingReview. https://t.co/khjBY3HgSl

tweets.text: 8y old Upper Aire Project site. The benefits of fencing & tree planting to kickstart. Natural regen now showing. @WildTroutTrust role to rehab instream habitat with small-medium woody material. Following video demos what it used to be like... https://t.co/X4z4IVGY8y

After 8 yrs of consultation shows EDF doesn't listen! Water Supply, Flood Risk, Marine Ecology, Terrestrial Ecology, Water Framework Directive, Permit Application overlap- all major areas of concern for the Environment agency re EDF's plans for Sizewell C
https://t.co/cBKHKgJ7QH

@MerseyRivers @CroxtethHall @EnvAgencyNW @ccnw1 @cpvolgroup Fabulous! I‚Äôd love to come take a look soon if you‚Äôre about! Superb looking case study. Encouraging to see continued action in spite of the lockdown

tweets.text: Our officers are investigating reports of #wastecrime in North Yorkshire. Illegal waste sites cause pollution and undermine legitimate business. Help stop waste crime. Report it to our incident hotline 0800 807060 or call Crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555 111 https://t.co/AGqb79XzPo

Cautions, enforcement notices, prosecutions and enforcement undertakings issued by the @EnvAgency  against businesses have crashed to unprecedentedly low levels this year.
https://t.co/sbU6st8yAw
@madasahatter197 Please report details direct to our 24/7 Incident Hotline to alert a local duty officer on 0800807060 - Joz

And we‚Äôre off!! üòÑ Work has begun on a new wetland @CroxtethHall to improve water quality in the River Alt. First job is to clear the scrub then onto the digging works...very exciting! @EnvAgencyNW @ccnw1 @cpvolgroup #nfm #ACCP https://t.co/e2ExIlVMVd

How it started.                         How it's going.

The Environment Agency's enforcement activity has shrunk to stunningly low levels this year, with the pandemic following years of funding cuts. https://t.co/rSArdoyMYO https://t.co/X814jn8paZ

tweets.text:
Reserved matters application for 147 homes in Cottenham rejected by @SouthCambs's planning committee. 

Design a big part of the rejection. Interesting as the applicant is @ThisLandLtd, the county council's arm's-length development company
Wandle running cloudy and with strong odour today due to heavy outfall from @thameswater's Beddington sewage works.  @Wandle_Trust https://t.co/vA0oxt6nZl

Having a 'trigger' to notify you of a #flood BEFORE it happens can allow time to prepare.

The @EnvAgencyNW Flood Warning Service is one such trigger, but do you know what the different stages mean?

Read our blog to learn more: https://t.co/5Hv1sf3FoV

#preparedness #floodaware https://t.co/eu5AuA3t83

They will be checking rod licence and byelaw compliance.

#Windermere #Cumbria #rodlicence #fishing https://t.co/tjeF3neXQc

tweets.text: Having identified an obstruction in a culvert at #Hemington #Leicestershire, our contractors @Drainsids have now removed the plastic crate that was causing an restriction. Unfortunately, a sewer pipe crosses within the culvert adding to potential blockages & future #floodrisk https://t.co/MkuMyW6ktW

Like a trip to the promised land the sun was shining on a rainy day when visiting the can do attitude of @EnvAgencySW @DCfieldteamsEA at Puslinch on the River Yealm.

Good progress being made with essential repairs to Gauging Station. Will be ship shape and Bristol fashion soon! https://t.co/1CP1Xncz2s

Our Fisheries Officers were checking & cleaning fish passes on the River Yarrow near Croston to ensure free passage for fish. Checks are carried out after recent high flows and for public safety. 

This is carried out after all heavy rainfall throughout the year.

#Lancashire https://t.co/4Zi7uDwNQo

@SallyLongford @EnvAgency Let‚Äôs hope they do a better job than the Track and Trace system. I finally spotted they the two alerts I got within 5 minutes were slightly different messages but sooo confusing. Crucial that Flood Alert/Flood Warning systems are simple and clear to follow https://t.co/1nFnhw0pOu

Do you often use cotton balls, pads or buds?
 
Never put them down the loo as they cause blockages and harm our environment. 
 
To protect your pipes and the environment, only flush the three Ps - poo, pee and toilet paper. 

#Unblocktober #BinIt4Beaches https://t.co/of9FDrTe5i

Today, our Chief Executive Sir @JamesBevanEA spoke at #FloodandCoast2020 about the #FCERMStrategy, setting out our ambitions to create a nation resilient to flooding and coastal change until 2100.

Here‚Äôs his speech, ‚ÄòCreating Climate Resilient Places‚Äô: https://t.co/BOfK6LqVqS https://t.co/TZyHG4ivvN

Unblocktober is the world‚Äôs first month-long national campaign and awareness month to improve the health of our drains, sewers, watercourses and seas. 

@unblocktober @YorkshireWater @RiverCalder 

To find out how you can help visit: https://t.co/QwDQNgy7Lf

#unblocktober https://t.co/hdqhSlW2cY

We've submitted plans for an exciting project to help the Lower Otter Valley adapt to climate change. If approved, the ¬£15 million EU funded scheme will create a stunning new nature reserve. Working with @ClintonDevon and others. https://t.co/Xer8f9JNA1 https://t.co/CW8nVVwsJi
